verbose_text: Before the SHC procedure (~ 2.25 h), octreotide (30 ng/kg.min -1) was infused to suppress endogenous pancreatic hormone secretion, and infusions of glucagon (1 ng/kg.min -1) and growth hormone (3 ng/kg.min -1) were started to restore basal plasma levels of these hormones (pancreatic clamp).
evidence: growth hormone (3 ng/kg.min -1 ) were started to restore basal plasma levels of these hormones (pancreatic clamp
